## Lab TA, Class TA, Tutor Application
  * View [this page ](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe79vKTkOp2J9auAD6Zw-m0htnsM8_l4WoiyHDqrPThd5hPZw/viewform?usp=sf_link)to apply.


## Administrative Request Form
  * View [this page ](https://forms.gle/txU7ZzUmuDisHWKz6)to complete the administrative help form.


## Assistantship Application Form
  * View [this page](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/assistantship-application-form/) to complete the assistantship form.


## Undergraduate Forms
  * [Current BSCS 4-Year Plan of Study](https://cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/BSCS_4yr_plan-revised.pdf)
  * [Current BSCS Completion Checklist](https://cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/BSCSChecksheet_23-24.pdf)

  * [Current BACS Completion Checklist](https://cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/BACS_Checksheet_23_24.pdf)
  * [CSci Prerequisite Flowchart](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PrereqFlowchart19_20.jpg)
  * [Exception to the Curriculum Form](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/excep-to-curric-reqst.pdf)


## Graduate Forms
  * [Graduate Application for Degree](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/grad-app-for-degree.pdf)

  * [MS Advising Checklist](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/ms-advis-checklist.pdf)
  * [PhD Advising Checklist](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/phd-advis-checklist.pdf)
  * [Research Proposal](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/res-proposal-form.pdf)
  * [Exception to the Curriculum Form](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/excep-to-curric-reqst.pdf)
  * [Graduate Document Evaluation Form](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/grad-doc-eval-form.pdf)
  * [Presentation Evaluation Form](http://csci.cs.olemiss.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/pres-eval-form.pdf)

# Requirements for Entering Honors Freshmen
  1. [Home](https://honors.olemiss.edu//index.php)
  2. [ Admissions ](https://honors.olemiss.edu//admissions/index.php)
  3. Requirements


## Prepare Yourself for Admission into the Honors College
#### Hours
The Honors College requires a minimum of 30 hours of honors credit. The following honors hours are required: Honors 101[](https://honors.olemiss.edu//admissions/requirements/#hon101) (3 hours); Honors 102[](https://honors.olemiss.edu//admissions/requirements/#hon101) (3 hours); and your Honors Capstone (up to 9 hours). Other hours come from taking honors sections of courses offered in various disciplines.
#### GPA
Students must have a minimum of a 3.50 grade point average in order to graduate as a Sally McDonnell Barksdale Honors Scholar. In the service of accomplishing this goal, Honors students must attain a minimum GPA of 3.20 at the end of the freshman year, a 3.40 at the end of the sophomore year, and a 3.50 by the end of the junior year. During the senior year, students should have at least a 3.50 cumulative GPA.
#### Academic Dismissal/Re-admittance Policy
Academic dismissals will be made after the spring semester. Students dismissed from the Honors College because of a low GPA may request re-admission if they bring their GPA up to the minimum for their year. For example, a freshman with lower than a 3.20 may pull his/her GPA up through summer school courses and re-enter the Honors College. To re-enter in a later year, a student needs to have the minimum GPA for that year. In other words, a freshman dismissed for not having a 3.20 would need to have at least a 3.40 as a sophomore to be readmitted.
#### **Capstone**
All students complete an Honors Capstone. The Honors Capstone is a special opportunity to work closely with a faculty advisor on a project related to one’s major or future career goals.
#### **The Honor Code**
The Sally McDonnell Barksdale Honors College employs an Honor Code centered on honesty, sincerity, and justice. The purpose of this Honor Code is to strengthen the sense of community in which the Honors College takes great pride. Its strength depends on the personal honor and integrity of each Honors College member. Honors students are required to write the following statement on any assignment submitted for grading in Honors classes, thereby reinforcing the atmosphere of trust within the Honors College community:
_**"On my honor, I pledge that I have neither given, received, nor witnessed any unauthorized help on this ___________"**_  
_**Signature: ______________**_
In addition to this pledge, the Honors College has instituted the following policy that is in effect in all honors classes:
_**Academic integrity is essential to all the values upon which the university is founded. Honors students must therefore embody academic honesty in all aspects of their work. A student with a documented case of plagiarism or academic cheating in an honors course will face the possibility of receiving the grade of F for the course and being dismissed from the Honors College. Specific consequences of such behavior will be determined by the administration and individual faculty member.**_
#### **Attendance Policy**
The following attendance policy was approved by the Honors Council in the spring of 1999.
_**Honors courses are small classes, usually taught in seminar style with no more than fifteen students. They are reading, writing and discussion intensive. Student participation is therefore essential. In addition, the university commits extensive resources, especially in terms of faculty time, to these small classes. For these reasons, the Honors College has an attendance policy for all honors courses, both required and departmental. Students are entitled to two absences in Tuesday/Thursday classes and to three absences in Monday/Wednesday/Friday classes. Consequences of additional absences will be determined by the individual faculty member.**_
#### Community Action Challenge
The patrons of the Honors College, Jim and Sally Barksdale, stipulated in their gift that the Honors College train the brightest minds in an atmosphere of service to the community, the state, and the nation. For that reason and for many others, SMBHC students are expected to be active during each academic semester in addressing the needs of their communities. The Community Action Challenge provides structure for that activity, promoting leadership and linking community action with individual students' concerns and interests. Community Action is broadly defined as **"voluntary action in the public sphere for the public good."** Areas of interest commonly understood to be "public sphere" include public policy, public health, education, the environment, literacy, poverty, social justice.
The philosophy behind the Community Action Challenge is to develop a sense of community responsibility in the best and brightest students at the University of Mississippi. We hope you will understand this component as a challenge to define your communities and the roles you will assume on their behalf. More details about the CAC expectation are shared in the [SMBHC Student Handbook](https://olemiss.box.com/s/ry5dft21qmc4j57tmnidjscpko5de1bz). 
#### Good Standing
Good standing is defined as meeting the minimum GPA requirement for your year, being up-to-date on the community action component, earning sufficient hours of honors credit, and upholding and obeying the Honors Senate courtesies. Those students not in good standing who remain in the Honors College on a probationary status will lose privileges like early registration.
### Making Things Work
The Honors College team is committed to advising you on how to make things work with your major and honors requirements. You can schedule an appointment through the [online appointment calendar](https://calendly.com/smbhc).
### Honors 101/102 
All Honors students completing the four-year requirements must take Honors 101 and 102. Honors 101 and 102 ordinarily will satisfy the six-hour English composition requirement. Alternatively, a student may apply all or part of the credits toward humanities or social science hours, especially if the student has AP English or other college composition credit. If used as humanities and social science credit, Honors 101 and 102 function differently in the various colleges and schools:
  * Business/Accountancy/Pharmacy: 6 hours of humanities
  * Engineering/Liberal Arts: 3 hours of humanities and 3 hours of social science
  * Education/Applied Sciences/Journalism/General Studies: 3 hours of humanities and 3 hours of electives; 3 hours of humanities and 3 hours of social sciences or 6 hours to either social sciences or humanities


Some schools, like Engineering or Liberal Arts, normally require two courses in sequence for the social science requirement. By counting Hon 101 or 102 toward these requirements, you often are released from having to take courses in sequence.

# Academic Calendars
Prospective and current students can plan ahead with these comprehensive calendars.
  1. [Home](https://olemiss.edu/index.php)
  2. [ Departmental Directory ](https://olemiss.edu/departments/index.php)
  3. [ Office of the Registrar ](https://olemiss.edu/departments/provost/registrar/index.php)
  4. Academic Calendars


![A student lies on a picnic table bench during a February day.](https://marvel-b1-cdn.bc0a.com/f00000000246364/olemiss.edu/departments/provost/registrar/calendars/hero_academic-calendars_sc-0002-c.jpg)
## **Fall, Spring, and Summer**
The University of Mississippi academic calendar runs on a semester system with fall and spring semesters spanning 16 weeks each. We also offer intersession and summer sessions with varying start and end dates.
Our calendar includes important dates such as registration deadlines, holidays, and final-exam periods. Calendar dates are subject to change, so it’s good to confirm before finalizing your plans.
## 2025 - 2026
Below is the academic calendar for 2025 - 2026, where you’ll find important dates and deadlines for the upcoming semesters.
###  Fall 2025
March 10 to April 7 | Monday to Monday | Academic Advising (Summer and Fall)  
---|---|---  
March 31 to April 14 | Monday to Monday | Priority Registration (Summer and Fall)  
March 31 to July 31 | Monday to Thursday | Phase 1 registration period  
July 31 | Thursday | Fall 2025 tuition and fees posted to students’ accounts.  
August 1 | Friday | $50 registration fee assessed this date. Phase 2 registration.  
August 20 | Wednesday | Bursar’s Office begins to distribute excess financial aid distributed to students via direct deposit or mail.  
August 24 | Sunday | Last day to officially cancel registration and avoid responsibility for payment of tuition and fees.  
August 25 | Monday | Classes begin; registration fee ($100) assessed this date; 100% refund (less 5% of fees or $100, whichever is less) on withdrawals through September 8. Phase 3 registration.  
August 29 | Friday | Students may add courses on a space available basis through this date.  
August 29 | Friday | Deadline for course withdrawals – (between August 30 and September 8 may drop only with instructor’s approval.) Refund period ends. –**Law classes only**  
September 1 | Monday | LABOR DAY HOLIDAY (Administrative Offices closed.)  
September 8 | Monday | Last day to register or add classes (between August 30 and September 8 may add only with instructor’s approval.) Refund period ends.  
September 8 | Monday | Deadline for course withdrawals –**Law Classes only**  
September 9 | Tuesday | $10 fee assessed per drop or add.  
September 15 | Monday | Mandatory drop date for non-attendance.  
October 6 | Monday | Midterm Grading/Progress Reports due.  
October 13 | Monday | Last day to submit applications for December diplomas.  
October 13 | Monday | Deadline for course withdrawals (no refund; refund period ended September 8).  
October 6 to November 3 | Monday to Monday | Academic Advising (for winter session and spring)  
October 6 to April 6 | Monday to Monday | Academic Advising (for all summer sessions)  
October 27 to November 10 | Monday to Monday | Priority Registration (for winter session and spring)  
October 27 to April 13 | Monday to Monday | Priority Registration (for all summer sessions)  
October 27 to November 30 | Monday to Sunday | Phase 1 registration period (for winter session and spring)  
October 27 to April 30 | Monday to Thursday | Phase 1 registration period (for May, full, and first summer sessions)  
October 27 to May 31 | Monday to Sunday | Phase 1 registration period (for second summer session)  
October 27 to June 30 | Monday to Tuesday | Phase 1 registration period (for August session)  
November 22 to November 30 | Sat-Sun | THANKSGIVING HOLIDAYS (Administrative Offices closed Thursday and Friday.)  
December 1 | Monday | Classes resume at 8:00 a.m.  
December 5 | Friday | Classes end.  
December 8 to 12 | Monday to Friday | Final Examinations  
###  First Fall Term 2025

---|---|---

*Important Information: Make-up days could possibly be added on Saturdays during the session or at the end of the published calendar which could include classes or exams the following week. Enrollees are encouraged to avoid making commitments that would prevent them from attending classes or exams that could be held on these make-up days if necessary due to weather or other unpredictable circumstances.

Academic Calendars

Prospective and current students can plan ahead with these comprehensive calendars.

  1. Home
  2. Departmental Directory
  3. Office of the Registrar
  4. Academic Calendars

Fall, Spring, and Summer

The University of Mississippi academic calendar runs on a semester system with fall and spring semesters spanning 16 weeks each. We also offer intersession and summer sessions with varying start and end dates.

Our calendar includes important dates such as registration deadlines, holidays, and final-exam periods. Calendar dates are subject to change, so it’s good to confirm before finalizing your plans.

July 31ThursdayMandatory drop date for non-attendance.
August 8FridayClasses end.
August 9SaturdayFinal examinations held.

### Friday System Maintenance
All IT systems (including email, Blackboard, myOleMiss, etc.) are unavailable 5-7:30 AM every Friday morning in order to perform scheduled maintenance. [See calendar for any schedule changes](http://ts.olemiss.edu/calendar.html).

## IT Services
### Academic Council Workflow
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


The Academic Council Workflow process provides academic administrators and council members a way of creating and managing academic requests, e.g. , adding or changing courses, programs, requirements, policies, etc. Requests are assigned to agendas, and agendas become minutes, providing an orderly way to track changes to the academic structure over time.
[View Academic Council Workflow Home](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal/?NavigationTarget=navurl://6568b11092c799dee12c67e44a3fdca3)
[View Academic Council Minutes](https://provost.olemiss.edu/minutes/)
[Request Access](https://sap.olemiss.edu/getting-started/)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _myOleMiss_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)
### Academic Discipline
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Academic Discipline allows instructors and employees to initiate an academic discipline case involving any student; provides students the ability to view case details and appeal; and allows authorized academic administrators and academic discipline committees to view cases along with the appeal and related attachments. A workflow drives the processing of the case and generates appropriate correspondence along the way.
[Initiate Case (Employees)](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://795718a964c7e9a2f74312121e468495&role=Employee&workset=Academics%20and%20Student%20Informa)
[View Case Information and/or Appeal (Students)](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://04f71d257f5d7fcfb3125420a1228bb5&role=Student&workset=Processes%20Involving%20Me)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _myOleMiss_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)
### Academic Programs and Catalog
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Academic Programs and Catalog lists online academic programs and catalog information for a selected academic year. Included are course prerequisites and co-requisites, program requirements, available majors and minors, faculty listings, etc. This service is available to the public.
[catalog.olemiss.edu](http://catalog.olemiss.edu)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _myOleMiss_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)
### Activity Reports & Evaluations
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Activity Reports & Evaluations allows faculty members to view their final activity reports (beginning year 2006 to present) and evaluations (beginning year 2007 to present). Evaluations use Adobe Interactive Forms technology and include a back-end workflow by which the form is routed from the chair to the faculty member and then to others in the reporting line. 
[My Activity Reports & Evaluations (for Faculty and Employee)](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://a8ad091f1542d7e5c41a78568fb99d9c)
[Activity Reports & Evaluations (for Academic Administrator)](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://cfc20bbd5e70c4c658de54b54bbfca99)
[Request Access](https://sap.olemiss.edu/getting-started/)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _myOleMiss_
Contact: [Faculty Technology Development Center](http://www.olemiss.edu/ftdc)
### Admission Applications
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Admission Applications allows prospective students to submit applications for admission into the University and includes options for Undergraduate, Graduate, International, and Law. A supplemental application for undergraduates may be required for non-Mississippi residents. The undergraduate admissions process is also complemented by the Special Program and Scholarship Application system. Once an applicant presses submit, a workflow is initiated, which routes the application through the various evaluation steps.
[Submit Applications](http://olemiss.edu/admission_application)
SANS classification: _Critical_
Categories: _myOleMiss_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)
### Admissions Confirmation
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Admission confirmation application helps the Office of Registrar and Office of Admissions gather data on students who are admitted for the next term. With this survey, they can get numbers for:
1. Students who accepted and will come to Ole Miss next semester
2. Students who are withdrawing their admission application and why.
3. Students who are deferring their admission application to a future term and year.
[Before signing into myOleMiss (myOleMiss landing page)](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal/anonymous?NavigationTarget=navurl://a0844eae973c9384bf8102452c0b56cf)
[After signing in myOleMiss](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://0df7b5f73de24a022327c4ff6592532a&role=New%20Student&workset=Admissions%20and%20Special%20P)

Advisors can view information about the students they advise by selecting the Advisor role/tab in myOleMiss and this role/tab will only appear if an advisor is assigned advisees. Under this tab, an advisor can view information on their advisees by selecting **Advisor Tools** => **Student Info for Advisors**
[myOleMiss -> Select Advisor Menu](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://8f149c160ffe2784d2b8ebe6834db7fe&role=Advisor)

  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


You can find out who your advisor is from the **Student** role in myOleMiss by selecting **Academics** followed by **My Advisors.** If an advisor has not been assigned, select the **Advising Coordinators** link to find out who to contact.
[Look Up Your Advisor](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://d196ce73f7a7777d072e3856ac37bd5b&role=Student&workset=Academics)

### Analytics Reporting
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Analytics Reporting is a new SAP reporting tool that enables authorized users to build, view, and quickly access SAP reports based on specified data selections. Some report examples are based on the student lifecycle management areas such as admissions, enrollment, course offerings and bookings, student specializations and graduation data. To access these reports, authorized users may login to **myOleMiss** => Select the **Employee** tab => **Analytics**.
[Analytics Reporting Information](http://technews.blog.olemiss.edu/analytics-reporting-new-sap-reports-at-your-fingertips/)
[Launch Analytics Reporting ](http://olemiss.edu/analytics)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _myOleMiss; Reporting & Analytics; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)
### Anti-Virus Software
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


A virus is a piece of self-replicating code, most often a malicious software program designed to destroy or damage information on computers. Sophos is the IT-supported anti-virus software used on UM computers to prevent virus infection. All employees are licensed to use Sophos on their work computer. Contact the IT Helpdesk or FTDC.
[Install Sophos on UM Computers](http://itsecurity.olemiss.edu/antivirus)
[View Anti-Virus Protection for UM Computers Policy](http://secure4.olemiss.edu/umpolicyopen/ShowDetails.jsp?istatPara=1&policyObjidPara=10644192)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _Personal Computer / Software_
Contact: [IT Helpdesk](http://www.olemiss.edu/helpdesk)

  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)

  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


The Office of Information Technology serves as steward for official University of Mississippi applications in the Apple iOS and Mac App Stores. Whether IT develops your iPhone/iPad/Mac application or you are partnering with an external developer, you must contact IT in order to place the app in the App Store.
[University of Mississippi iOS App Store](http://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/university-of-mississippi/id472729170)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _Accounts, Authority, & Access; Help & Training; Instructional Technology; Web, Mobility & Collaboration_

### Astra Schedule
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)

  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Astra Schedule, an interactive scheduling system, helps coordinate academic/non-academic event and resource scheduling functions in one enterprise-wide system. Astra Schedule is integrated with SAP for academic room assignments.
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _SAP & Other Enterprise Applications_
### Attendance Tracking Scanner
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)

  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


The Attendance Tracking Scanner is a class attendance tracking device that operates with FABI and the SAP system to update class attendance based on location, time, class, and student in near real-time when students scan their University IDs. Results are made available to the instructor within myOleMiss under the **Faculty Role** =>**Course Administration** =>**Class Rolls and Grades**.
[Attendance Tracking Scanners for UM Classrooms](http://technews.blog.olemiss.edu/new-attendance-tracking-scanners-for-um-classrooms/)
[Freshman Attendance-Based Program: Keeping UM Freshmen Under Control!](http://technews.blog.olemiss.edu/freshman-attendance-based-program-kee)
SANS classification: _Essential_
Categories: _Instructional Technology; myOleMiss_
### Blackboard
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)
  * [Employees](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat3)
  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Blackboard is a mobile and Web-based learning management system that allows instructors to put their syllabi, lecture notes, PowerPoint presentations, assignments, and grades online for students to access at any time. Blackboard also includes interactive features, such as peer review, discussion boards, and virtual chat rooms, which enhance communication between students and faculty. Plagiarism detection is also provided via Safe Assignments within Blackboard.
[University of Mississippi Blackboard ](https://blackboard.olemiss.edu)
[Installing Blackboard Mobile](http://technews.olemiss.edu/blackboard-mobile-learn/)
[More Information](http://www.olemiss.edu/blackboard)
SANS classification: _Critical_
Categories: _Instructional Technology_
Contact: [Faculty Technology Development Center](http://www.olemiss.edu/ftdc)
### Box.com
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)
  * [Faculty](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat2)

  * [Administrators](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat4)
  * [Visitors](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat5)


Box is a secure, online file sharing and storage service. Content on Box can be accessed from your computer and through iPad, iPhone and Android devices via the Box app. Box content can also be shared internally and externally and can be extended to partner applications such as Google Docs. Box is a good resource for storing and sharing files, authoring content, and encouraging collaboration.
[Visit Box.com](http://box.olemiss.edu)
SANS classification: _Mission Critical_
Categories: _Accounts, Authority, & Access; Email, Calendar, Communication; Web, Mobility & Collaboration_
### Cable TV Service for Departments
  * [Students](https://olemiss.edu/depts/it/servicesr1.html?class=sortcat1)

Departments may request to have campus cable TV services in their departments via an SAP notification. Cable TV services are billed annually and are prorated from the install date through the end of the current fiscal year. If SAP access is not available, requests may be submitted via email to telcom@olemiss.edu.
[More Information](http://telecom.olemiss.edu/television.html)

Students are provided cable TV services in all residential hall rooms. Expanded cable TV service for students living in residential halls is available upon request by signing up online via the Telecommunications website. Cable TV services above the provided basic package will be billed monthly to the student’s bursar account.
[Sign up for Expanded Cable TV Packages](http://telecom.olemiss.edu/television.html)

The Network Blocked List contains the Internet Protocol (IP) and Media Access Control addresses of computers and network devices that are currently blocked from accessing the campus network for a variety of reasons, such as copyright infringement, viruses, malware, or spam. One of the most common reasons for being blocked is a notification from the RIAA or DCMA that the computer is in violation of copyright laws, for example through peer to peer file sharing. In this case, you will need to visit the IT Helpdesk to regain access.

This program, which is funded by the Provost's Office and facilitated by Information Technology, is an attempt to assist faculty who have had inadequate access to technology for curriculum development. The goal is to replace faculty members' primary computers; giving them more immediate access to-and ready capacity to create-technology resources.
[Visit TACIT](http://www.olemiss.edu/tacit)

The UM Teacher Evaluation process is completely online, including the interface to submit evaluations and the interface to view evaluation results. There are two incentives for completing your evaluations in a timely manner in Fall and Spring terms. If you submit 100% of your evaluations before final grades are made available, you will be able to view your grades up to 12 hours earlier than other students. Also, you will be able to register a day early for the following Fall or Spring term.

Friday System Maintenance

All IT systems (including email, Blackboard, myOleMiss, etc.) are unavailable 5-7:30 AM every Friday morning in order to perform scheduled maintenance. See calendar for any schedule changes.

Maintenance Calendar

  • IT Work Request Form
  • Academic Computing
  • Application Development and Integration

IT Services

Academic Council Workflow

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Academic Council Workflow process provides academic administrators and council members a way of creating and managing academic requests, e.g. , adding or changing  courses, programs, requirements, policies, etc.  Requests are assigned to agendas, and agendas become minutes, providing an orderly way to track changes to the academic structure over time.

View Academic Council Workflow Home

View Academic Council Minutes

Request Access

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Academic Discipline

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Academic Discipline allows instructors and employees to initiate an academic discipline case involving any student; provides students the ability to view case details and appeal; and allows authorized academic administrators and academic discipline committees to view cases along with the appeal and related attachments.  A workflow drives the processing of the case and generates appropriate correspondence along the way.

Initiate Case (Employees)

View Case Information and/or Appeal (Students)

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Academic Programs and Catalog

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Academic Programs and Catalog lists online academic programs and catalog information for a selected academic year.  Included are course prerequisites and co-requisites, program requirements, available majors and minors, faculty listings, etc.  This service is available to the public.

catalog.olemiss.edu

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Activity Reports & Evaluations

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Activity Reports & Evaluations allows faculty members to view their final activity reports (beginning year 2006 to present) and evaluations (beginning year 2007 to present).  Evaluations use Adobe Interactive Forms technology and include a back-end workflow by which the form is routed from the chair to the faculty member and then to others in the reporting line. 

My Activity Reports & Evaluations (for Faculty and Employee)

Activity Reports & Evaluations (for Academic Administrator)

Request Access

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Admission Applications

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Admission Applications allows prospective students to submit applications for admission into the University and includes options for Undergraduate, Graduate, International, and Law.  A supplemental application for undergraduates may be required for non-Mississippi residents.  The undergraduate admissions process is also complemented by the Special Program and Scholarship Application system. Once an applicant presses submit, a workflow is initiated, which routes the application through the various evaluation steps.

Submit Applications

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Admissions Confirmation

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Admission confirmation application helps the Office of Registrar and Office of Admissions gather data on students who are admitted for the next term. With this survey, they can get numbers for:

1. Students who accepted and will come to Ole Miss next semester

2. Students who are withdrawing their admission application and why.

3. Students who are deferring their admission application to a future term and year.

Before signing into myOleMiss (myOleMiss landing page)

After signing in myOleMiss

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss

Advising - Advisors

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Advisors can view information about the students they advise by selecting the Advisor role/tab in myOleMiss and this role/tab will only appear if an advisor is assigned advisees. Under this tab, an advisor can view information on their advisees by selecting Advisor Tools => Student Info for Advisors

myOleMiss -> Select Advisor Menu

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Advising - Students

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

You can find out who your advisor is from the Student role in myOleMiss by selecting Academics  followed by My Advisors.   If an advisor has not been assigned, select the Advising Coordinators link to find out who to contact.

Look Up Your Advisor

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Analytics Reporting

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Analytics Reporting is a new SAP reporting tool that enables authorized users to build, view, and quickly access SAP reports based on specified data selections.  Some report examples are based on the student lifecycle management areas such as admissions, enrollment, course offerings and bookings, student specializations and graduation data.  To access these reports, authorized users may login to myOleMiss => Select the Employee tab => Analytics.

Analytics Reporting Information

Launch Analytics Reporting

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; Reporting & Analytics; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Anti-Virus Software

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

A virus is a piece of self-replicating code, most often a malicious software program designed to destroy or damage information on computers.  Sophos is the IT-supported anti-virus software used on UM computers to prevent virus infection.  All employees are licensed to use Sophos on their work computer.  Contact the IT Helpdesk or FTDC.

Install Sophos on UM Computers

View Anti-Virus Protection for UM Computers Policy

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Personal Computer / Software
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Apple iOS/Mac App Store Deployment

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Office of Information Technology serves as steward for official University of Mississippi applications in the Apple iOS and Mac App Stores. Whether IT develops your iPhone/iPad/Mac application or you are partnering with an external developer, you must contact IT in order to place the app in the App Store.

University of Mississippi iOS App Store

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Accounts, Authority, & Access; Help & Training; Instructional Technology; Web, Mobility & Collaboration
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Astra Schedule

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Astra Schedule, an interactive scheduling system, helps coordinate academic/non-academic event and resource scheduling functions in one enterprise-wide system.  Astra Schedule is integrated with SAP for academic room assignments.

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: SAP & Other Enterprise Applications

Attendance Tracking Scanner

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Attendance Tracking Scanner is a class attendance tracking device that operates with FABI and the SAP system to update class attendance based on location, time, class, and student in near real-time when students scan their University IDs.  Results are made available to the instructor within myOleMiss under the Faculty Role => Course Administration =>  Class Rolls and Grades.

Attendance Tracking Scanners for UM Classrooms

Freshman Attendance-Based Program: Keeping UM Freshmen Under Control!

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Instructional Technology; myOleMiss

Blackboard

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Blackboard is a mobile and Web-based learning management system that allows instructors to put their syllabi, lecture notes, PowerPoint presentations, assignments, and grades online for students to access at any time.  Blackboard also includes interactive features, such as peer review, discussion boards, and virtual chat rooms, which enhance communication between students and faculty. Plagiarism detection is also provided via Safe Assignments within Blackboard.

University of Mississippi Blackboard

Installing Blackboard Mobile

More Information

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: Instructional Technology
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Box.com

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Box is a secure, online file sharing and storage service. Content on Box can be accessed from your computer and through iPad, iPhone and Android devices via the Box app. Box content can also be shared internally and externally and can be extended to partner applications such as Google Docs. Box is a good resource for storing and sharing files, authoring content, and encouraging collaboration.

Visit Box.com

SANS classification: Mission Critical
Categories: Accounts, Authority, & Access; Email, Calendar, Communication; Web, Mobility & Collaboration

Cable TV Service for Departments

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Departments may request to have campus cable TV services in their departments via an SAP notification. Cable TV services are billed annually and are prorated from the install date through the end of the current fiscal year. If SAP access is not available, requests may be submitted via email to telcom@olemiss.edu.

More Information

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Telecommunications & Networking
Contact: Telecommunications Center

Cable TV Service for Students

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Students are provided cable TV services in all residential hall rooms. Expanded cable TV service for students living in residential halls is available upon request by signing up online via the Telecommunications website. Cable TV services above the provided basic package will be billed monthly to the student’s bursar account.

Sign up for Expanded Cable TV Packages

More Information

SANS classification: Non-Critical
Categories: Telecommunications & Networking
Contact: Telecommunications Center

Campus Map

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The interactive Campus Map allows you to locate buildings, departments, parking lots, accessible parking areas, landmarks, food and shopping places, and other points of interests on campus.

Visit Campus Map

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Web, Mobility & Collaboration
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Campus Server Registration

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Departments maintaining computer systems, providing services to outside entities, and housing workstations that contain sensitive data are required to register these machines in the Campus Server Registry.   

Visit Campus Server Registration

More Information

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: Accounts, Authority, & Access; Servers & Data
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Cell Phones and Mobile Devices

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Cell phones and mobile devices can be configured to retrieve campus email and to access the campus calendar server.  A Distributed Antenna System (DAS) has been installed in the Grove, Stadium, and other locations to provide extra support for cell service. A mobile version of our website is available giving easy access to several myOleMiss applications. And in 2012, we released the Official Ole Miss App for the iPad with availability on more devices to come.

Policy on Wireless Devices

More Information

SANS classification: Mission Critical
Categories: Email, Calendar, Communication
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Certify Effort

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Certify Effort service allows researchers to certify the percentage of time spent on research and sponsored programs for each certification period during the year.

Certify Effort

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications

Class Rolls and Grades

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Instructors can access class rolls within myOleMiss by choosing the Faculty role => Course Administration => Class Rolls and Grades . You will be prompted to select academic term and year, and then a list of sections for which you have access will be presented along with a drop-down menu of actions such as Class Roll.  During the windows for midterm and final grades submission, you will see additional links to enter or upload your grades.

Visit Class Rolls and Grades

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: Instructional Technology; myOleMiss
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Classroom Technology

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Classroom Technology provides faculty, staff, and students the necessary technology for various teaching strategies and learning styles in the classroom. Funding for the Classroom Technology infrastructure is provided by the Office of the Provost. The Instructional Technology Standing Committee of the Faculty Senate makes decisions each year on new classroom technology projects to fund.  For immediate assistance with classroom technology issues, call the IT Helpdesk at 662-915-5222 and select the appropriate menu item for Classroom Technology Rapid Response.

Visit Classroom Technology Website

Instructional Technology Standing Committee

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Instructional Technology
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Clickers

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Clickers are wireless keypads or personal response systems that instructors can use to increase interactivity in the classroom. This technology provides instant feedback to both instructors and students.  The Turning Technologies QT or QT2 Device is the officially supported personal response system (i.e. clicker) on campus.  A set of 50 clickers is available for checkout from the Faculty Technology Development Center.

Learn more about Clickers by Turning Technologies

More Information

SANS classification: Non-Critical
Categories: Instructional Technology
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Committee Memberships

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

IT has developed a method in SAP to track UM committee memberships.  The Chancellor's Office uses this tool to add and remove people from committees.  You can view many committee memberships from the Standing Committees Website.  Also, committee memberships are automatically displayed in Faculty Activity Reports.  

UM Standing Committees

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: SAP & Other Enterprise Applications; Web, Mobility & Collaboration

Countdown Timer

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Countdown Timer provides instructors with a online timer that has a user-specified duration. The timer may also be projected for classroom use.  This service was requested by UM instructors to time in-class activities.  Select the Faculty role in myOleMiss => Course Administration => Countdown Timer.

Visit Countdown Timer

SANS classification: Non-Critical
Categories: Instructional Technology
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Course Materials

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Instructors, department chairs, and agents can enter textbook information using Course Materials Management.  Once the assignments are finalized, the Bookstore, students, and the public can view the assigned course materials, including ISBN numbers, through Course Materials and in the Course Schedule.  Also, use the "Search" box within myOleMiss to see Course Materials Management.

Visit Course Materials (Bookstore / Public View)

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Instructional Technology; myOleMiss
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Course Materials Management

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Course Materials Management allows instructors, department chairs, and agents to enter textbooks, software, course packs, and other supplies and equipment for the sections they are teaching. Once the assignments are finalized, they are available to students, the Bookstore and the public.   Departments can designate course "agents" who have responsibility for assigning textbooks for all sections of a course.  See also Course Materials.

Access from Class Rolls and Grades

Course Materials Management

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Instructional Technology; myOleMiss
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Course Registration

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Course Registration allows students to register for UM courses.  You can build/view your schedule, drop courses, check for academic holds, check your registration window, etc. My Course Favorites is a temporary staging area where you can collect courses that you want to add to your schedule.  From the Student role in myOleMiss, select the Course Registration.

myOleMiss -> select Course Registration

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications

Course Schedule

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Course Schedule shows all sections that are offered for a given academic year and term.  You may search by course name, organization, instructor, meeting time, subject, location, etc. You may view course pre and co-requisites by selecting the course name.   View All Sections shows section details such as instructor, meeting time, location, capacity, and any registration rules.  The employee view includes additional details not available to the public and students such as waitlisted students. See also Event Planning.

Visit Course Schedule (Public View)

Visit Course Schedule (Employee View)

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: Instructional Technology; myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Degree Audit (Administrators)

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Degree Audit is an advising tool for viewing a student's progress toward fulfillment of degree requirements. Academic Administrators can access Degree Audit information through the Academic Administrator role in myOleMiss => Degree Audit. Degree Audit Help provides more information on how to use the Degree Audit system.

View Degree Audit Interface

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Degree Audit (Advisors)

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Degree Audit is an advising tool for viewing a student's progress toward fulfillment of degree requirements. Advisors can access Degree Audit through the Advisor role in myOleMiss => Advising Tools. Degree Audit is accessible within the Advisor Menu => Advisee Details option. Degree Audit Help provides more information about how to use the Degree Audit system.

View Degree Audit Interface

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Degree Audit (Students)

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Degree Audit is an advising tool for viewing a student's progress toward fulfillment of degree requirements. Students can access Degree Audit through the Student role in myOleMiss =>Degree Progress => Degree Audit. Degree Audit Help provides more information about how to use the Degree Audit system.

Degree Audit Interface

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Departmental Software Purchases

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Licenses for Microsoft and Adobe software products, and Symantec Antivirus are available for departmental purchase through the FTDC. These licenses may be purchased for installation on any university-owned computer. To purchase any of these software titles, you will need to have available a departmental account number, as well as the property control number of the computer on which the software will be installed.

Visit Software Purchase Form

Visit Software Descriptions

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: Personal Computer / Software; Technology Purchases
Contact: Faculty Technology Development Center

Digital Imaging

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Digital Imaging system is a Web-based document storage and retrieval system that allows campus departments to store documents and grant authorized users access to those documents at any time. The digital imaging system is integrated into many web and offline processes, as well as providing support for the daily operations of departments.

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: SAP & Other Enterprise Applications; Servers & Data

Diploma Application

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Diploma Application allows authorized students to complete the diploma application form and the graduating student survey.  To access the form, the student must first be authorized by his or her Dean's Office. You may access the form from the Student role within myOleMiss => Academics => Diploma Application.

Visit Diploma Application

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Diploma Authorization

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Deans' offices authorize students to submit diploma application information and complete the Graduating Student Survey.  This step feeds into the graduation process. 

Access for Authorized Deans and Delegates

Request Access

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Electronic Forms (E-forms)

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

The Electronic Forms (E-forms) application in myOleMiss allows e-form users to create, edit, approve, reject, route, and view e-forms.  Once complete, the forms are archived in UM's digital imaging system.  To request access to e-forms, contact Human Resources at (662) 915-7431.

E-forms Introduction

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications

Email for Employees

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

All UM employees are issued an @olemiss.edu email address.  To check your email, use Office 365 Mail or an email client such as Microsoft Outlook. Access is secured with your WebID account.  Faculty and staff may also sign up for a Google email (Gmail) account.  This account will be an additional account for UM Gmail and other Google apps, leaving the Office 365 Mail account to be used for official UM correspondence. 

Configure Email Clients for Office 365 Mail

More Information on UM Gmail

SANS classification: Mission Critical
Categories: Accounts, Authority, & Access; Email, Calendar, Communication
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Email for Students

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

All UM students are issued an official email address when they are admitted.  This is the primary means of communication from the administration, instructors, and advisors.  UM students will be issued UM Gmail accounts.  UM Gmail addresses have the @go.olemiss.edu extension.

More Information on UM Gmail

Read the TECHNews Article Announcing UM Gmail

SANS classification: Critical
Categories: Accounts, Authority, & Access; Email, Calendar, Communication
Contact: IT Helpdesk

Employee Self-Service (ESS)

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a suite of applications within myOleMiss that allows employees to submit their time worked for supervisor approval, view their pay stubs, update their home, office, and emergency addresses, update their direct deposit information and view their current benefit plans.  They can also change their benefits plans during open enrollment in the fall and opt-in to receive their W2 forms online during tax season.  

Visit Employee Self-Service (ESS)

SANS classification: Essential
Categories: myOleMiss; SAP & Other Enterprise Applications

Enrollment Verification

  • Students
  • Faculty
  • Employees
  • Administrators
  • Visitors

Enrollment Verification, a service offered by the National Student Clearinghouse in cooperation with the University of Mississippi, allows students to obtain verification forms that confirm proof of their enrollment and academic status as a good student for the current term; view specific information about their student loans; view their student loan deferment notifications and proof of their enrollment that Clearinghouse provides to loan holders, health insurers, and/or other providers of student services/products.

## Leadership
  * [Yixin Chen](http://www.olemiss.edu/people/yixin) - Chair and Professor of Computer and Information Science


## Contact
201 Weir Memorial Hall  
University, MS 38677  
chair@cs.olemiss.edu  
<http://www.cs.olemiss.edu/>
## Overview
The Department of Computer and Information Science offers the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (B.S.C.S.) and Bachelor of Science in Data Science (B.S.D.S.) degrees for engineering students. For students in the College of Liberal Arts, the department offers a minor and a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in computer science. At the graduate level, the department has offerings for the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in engineering science. The latter graduate degrees are listed under the School of Engineering.
## Accreditation
The following undergraduate engineering programs are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org: Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Geological Engineering, and Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) program of the Department of Computer and Information Science is accredited as a Computer Science program by the Computing Accreditation Commission (CAC) of ABET https://www.abet.org.
The policies and regulations contained in this online University of Mississippi Catalog are in effect for the current or selected semester. The catalog is not a contract, but rather a guide for the convenience of students. The University of Mississippi reserves the right to 1) change or withdraw courses; 2) change the fees, rules, and schedules for admission, registration, instruction, and graduation; and 3) change other regulations affecting the student body at any time. Implicit in each student’s enrollment with the university is an agreement to comply with university rules and regulations, which the university may modify to exercise properly its educational responsibility.

Leadership

  • Yixin Chen - Chair and Professor of Computer and Information Science

Contact

201 Weir Memorial Hall
University, MS 38677
chair@cs.olemiss.edu
http://www.cs.olemiss.edu/

Overview

The Department of Computer and Information Science offers the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (B.S.C.S.) and Bachelor of Science in Data Science (B.S.D.S.) degrees for engineering students. For students in the College of Liberal Arts, the department offers a minor and a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in computer science. At the graduate level, the department has offerings for the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in engineering science. The latter graduate degrees are listed under the School of Engineering.

Accreditation

The following undergraduate engineering programs are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org: Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Bachelor of Science in Geological Engineering, and Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) program of the Department of Computer and Information Science is accredited as a Computer Science program by the Computing Accreditation Commission (CAC) of ABET https://www.abet.org.

Implicit in each student’s enrollment with the university is an agreement to comply with university rules and regulations, which the university may modify to exercise properly its educational responsibility.

# Registration
Find essential registration information such as registration windows, maximum course load, priority registration, late registration, course add/drop procedures, and university withdrawal policies.
  1. [Home](https://olemiss.edu/index.php)
  2. [ Departmental Directory ](https://olemiss.edu/departments/index.php)
  3. [ Office of the Registrar ](https://olemiss.edu/departments/provost/registrar/index.php)
  4. Registration


![A student in a class writes on the board as her other classmates stand behind her and watch.](https://marvel-b1-cdn.bc0a.com/f00000000246364/olemiss.edu/departments/provost/registrar/assets/registration-hero-sc_0463-ap.jpg)
## Winter Intersession, Spring Semester 2025, and Summer 2025 Registration Dates
  * **Monday, October 27th** – Students with priority registration statuses
  * **Tuesday, October 28th** – Students with priority registration statuses, Graduate Students, Pharmacy Students (3rd and 4th year)
  * **Wednesday, October 29th** – Pharmacy Students, Provost Scholars, Unclassified Students, Seniors*
  * **Thursday, October 30th** – Juniors*, Sophomores*
  * **Friday, October 31st** – Freshmen*


_* for students in these groups, once your priority group is assigned, your registration order for the day assigned is based on the total number of hours you have; including transfer, resident earned, and current semester attempted hours._
### Meet with your Academic Advisor
Continuing students, readmitted former students, and new graduate students should schedule an appointment with their advisor either before or during the advising period. First-year freshmen are advised by the [Center for Student Success and First-Year Experience](https://olemiss.edu/departments/student-affairs/student-success-first-year-experience/advising/index.php) (CSSFYE). 
  * An advisor hold will remain on your account until you have completed your advising meeting


[Who is My Academic Advisor?](https://www.olemiss.edu/myadvisor)
### Check Holds on Your Account
If you have any holds on your record, you cannot register for classes. You will need to contact the office that has placed a hold on your record before you will be allowed to register for classes. Make sure you have cleared all holds before your registration window opens to prevent any delays. 
  * Holds can only be cleared by the office who placed the hold


[Check for Holds](https://www.olemiss.edu/holds)
### Add Courses to Your Schedule
After your academic advisor approves your schedule and any holds are cleared from your account, you’ll be ready to register for classes once your registration window opens. You can find when your registration window opens in myOleMiss. 
  * Learn how to add and drop courses from your schedule in myOleMiss


[How to Register](https://my.olemiss.edu/irj/portal?NavigationTarget=navurl://cdcbff95f84a4ab09fa40037b042f854&role=Student)
## Important Registration Information
Ensure you're aware of important dates, your priority status, and the process to secure your classes. Whether you're a new or returning student, this information will guide you through what you need to know for successful registration.
###  Registration Windows
#### **How do I find my registration window?**
  * Log into [myOleMiss](https://my.olemiss.edu/)
  * Click on your “Student” tab.
  * Go to Course Registration and click the + to expand your list of Applications.
  * Click on “Check Registration Window”


For questions email registrar@olemiss.edu.
#### Registration priority is assigned based on the following:
  * Priority registration status (VA, Students with Disabilities, etc.)
  * Classification (freshman, sophomore, junior, senior, graduate student, etc.)
    * Transfer Hours: Credits you earned from other college/universities.
    * Resident Earned Hours: Credits you earned at the University of Mississippi.
    * Current Semester Attempted Hours: Credits you are taking in the current semester.
  * Completion of Teacher Evaluations for prior completed semester.


###  Registration Eligibility
To be eligible to register for classes, a student must be:
  1. a new student who applies for admission and receives a certificate of admission,
  2. a continuing student from the preceding regular semester or summer term,
  3. OR a former student, not enrolled in the preceding regular semester or summer term, who applies for re-admission and receives a certificate of re-admission.


###  New Student Registration
Each new undergraduate student attends an orientation session prior to, or at the beginning of, the student’s first semester. During this session, new students are given special assistance in setting up their first class schedule and are able to register for their classes.
###  Full-Time Course Load and Maximum Course Load
**Full-time enrollment** at the undergraduate level is defined as 12 credit hours for a fall or spring regular registration period.
  * This definition does not depend on the mode of course delivery or the location of the course.
  * Courses taken as Independent Study are not counted toward the course load of a given semester.


The **maximum course load** is 21 hours for a regular semester.
  * Students are advised not to take more than 19 hours without a compelling reason and a **cumulative** GPA four-tenths of a point above 2.0 for each extra hour desired.
  * **To register for more than 19 hours, a student must seek permission from his or her dean's office.**


###  Priority Registration
**Continuing students** may register online by using their WebID through the [**myOleMiss**](https://my.olemiss.edu/) portal.
  * Online class schedules for an upcoming priority registration period are available approximately two weeks prior to the beginning of priority registration.
  * An academic advisor must approve each student’s schedule.
  * The time when a student may begin registration varies for different categories of students.
  * Students accept the responsibility for maintaining acceptable grades and for the payment of fees at the time they register.


###  Late Registration
Students who do not register before classes begin have until the last day to register, which is the 10th day of classes of a regular semester, to complete the process. During this period, a late registration fee will be assessed. No student will be permitted to register for classes after the last day to register without a serious and compelling reason approved by the dean of the student’s school or college. In no case may a student register after the last regular class day in any semester.
###  Late Add Requests
You can add courses online through your myOleMiss account until the course registration period ends, as noted in the academic calendar. After the fifth day of classes in the fall or spring semester, you’ll need to submit an add slip to the College or School offering the course and request permission via your go.olemiss.edu email account. Be sure to review any specific information or instructions provided on each College or School's form. For questions about adding a course, please contact the Dean's office of the College or School offering the course.
**College of Liberal Arts** | [Course Add Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdC5DoFs4xAnw6ZQF0hw_EjmB2pPCQCBsOQ_Ca-QLKejgrBAA/viewform) | libartsadvising@olemiss.edu
**School of Accountancy** | [Course Add Form](https://forms.gle/GPnzCQwFcJ2ToMjU6)
**School of Applied Sciences** | [Course Add Form](https://uofmississippi.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3QqmerMQhjMv2OW) | SASadvising@olemiss.edu
**School of Business** | [Course Add Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfXuAYoGLwaHyaMJ_AxNZxF7Ie35S5PSl1KifjSzu1WoRFgZA/closedform)
**School of Education** | [Course Add Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScONsy2mHNskubI2j6bn220MjWPDP9BxZikmpyaXBarlWK3Jw/viewform?usp=sf_link)
**School of Engineering** | [Course Add Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScy7WHgRFAHMgJleXhN1u1kaODu62zyyj9F9YzVQ9_caO4T_w/viewform "Course Add Form")
**School of Journalism** | [Course Add Form](https://forms.gle/Rqt9HCySPnqtFE547) | jour-imc@olemiss.edu
**School of Pharmacy** | [Contact Directly](https://pharmacy.olemiss.edu/index.php)
###  Drop/Add Procedures
Students may add courses, using the [**myOleMiss**](https://my.olemiss.edu/) portal, through the fifth day in which classes meet during a regular semester.
  * After the fifth day, students must have the approval of the instructor in the course.
  * After the 10th day of classes (the last day to register), courses may be added only under extraordinary circumstances approved by the dean of the school or college in which the student is enrolled, and a small fee will be assessed per added course.
  * In no case may a student add a class after the last regular class day in any semester.


A student may drop any course, using the online system, until the course withdrawal deadline, which is the 30th day in which classes meet during a regular semester. However, after the 10th day of classes a small fee will be assessed per dropped course. No indication of enrollment in a course properly dropped will be shown on any University of Mississippi record.
###  Withdrawal from the University
A student who wishes to withdraw from the university (i.e., withdraw from all courses) during the course of a semester, intersession, or summer term can withdraw online at [myOleMiss.edu](https://my.olemiss.edu/) or can provide written notification via fax, mail, or in person to the Office of the Registrar.
  * Appropriate university offices (Student Housing, Financial Aid, Bursar, ID Center, [Library](https://www.libraries.olemiss.edu/), and Academic Dean) will be notified of the withdrawal.
  * Full refunds of tuition and fees (minus a processing fee) are given for withdrawals during the first 10 days of classes of a regular semester, and no refunds are given after the 10th day of classes.
  * Students who withdraw must apply for readmission if not enrolling for the subsequent term.


  * ### Academic Calendar
View the academic calendar to find priority registration dates for the semester, the last day to add or drop a course, and more.

Registration

Find essential registration information such as registration windows, maximum course load, priority registration, late registration, course add/drop procedures, and university withdrawal policies.

  1. Home
  2. Departmental Directory
  3. Office of the Registrar
  4. Registration

Winter Intersession, Spring Semester 2025, and Summer 2025 Registration Dates

  • Monday, October 27th – Students with priority registration statuses
  • Tuesday, October 28th – Students with priority registration statuses, Graduate Students, Pharmacy Students (3rd and 4th year)
  • Wednesday, October 29th – Pharmacy Students, Provost Scholars, Unclassified Students, Seniors*
  • Thursday, October 30th – Juniors*, Sophomores*
  • Friday, October 31st – Freshmen*

* for students in these groups, once your priority group is assigned, your registration order for the day assigned is based on the total number of hours you have; including transfer, resident earned, and current semester attempted hours.

Meet with your Academic Advisor

Continuing students, readmitted former students, and new graduate students should schedule an appointment with their advisor either before or during the advising period. First-year freshmen are advised by the Center for Student Success and First-Year Experience (CSSFYE).

  • An advisor hold will remain on your account until you have completed your advising meeting
Who is My Academic Advisor?

Check Holds on Your Account

If you have any holds on your record, you cannot register for classes. You will need to contact the office that has placed a hold on your record before you will be allowed to register for classes. Make sure you have cleared all holds before your registration window opens to prevent any delays.

  • Holds can only be cleared by the office who placed the hold
Check for Holds

Add Courses to Your Schedule

After your academic advisor approves your schedule and any holds are cleared from your account, you’ll be ready to register for classes once your registration window opens. You can find when your registration window opens in myOleMiss.

  • Learn how to add and drop courses from your schedule in myOleMiss
How to Register

Important Registration Information

Ensure you're aware of important dates, your priority status, and the process to secure your classes. Whether you're a new or returning student, this information will guide you through what you need to know for successful registration.

How do I find my registration window?

  • Log into myOleMiss
  • Click on your “Student” tab.
  • Go to Course Registration and click the + to expand your list of Applications.
  • Click on “Check Registration Window”

For questions email registrar@olemiss.edu.

Registration priority is assigned based on the following:

  • Priority registration status (VA, Students with Disabilities, etc.)
  • Classification (freshman, sophomore, junior, senior, graduate student, etc.)
    • Transfer Hours: Credits you earned from other college/universities.
    • Resident Earned Hours: Credits you earned at the University of Mississippi.
    • Current Semester Attempted Hours: Credits you are taking in the current semester.
  • Completion of Teacher Evaluations for prior completed semester.

To be eligible to register for classes, a student must be:

  1. a new student who applies for admission and receives a certificate of admission,
  2. a continuing student from the preceding regular semester or summer term,
  3. OR a former student, not enrolled in the preceding regular semester or summer term, who applies for re-admission and receives a certificate of re-admission.

Each new undergraduate student attends an orientation session prior to, or at the beginning of, the student’s first semester. During this session, new students are given special assistance in setting up their first class schedule and are able to register for their classes.

Full-time enrollment at the undergraduate level is defined as 12 credit hours for a fall or spring regular registration period.

  • This definition does not depend on the mode of course delivery or the location of the course.
  • Courses taken as Independent Study are not counted toward the course load of a given semester.

The maximum course load is 21 hours for a regular semester.

  • Students are advised not to take more than 19 hours without a compelling reason and a cumulative GPA four-tenths of a point above 2.0 for each extra hour desired.
  • To register for more than 19 hours, a student must seek permission from his or her dean's office.

Continuing students may register online by using their WebID through the myOleMiss portal.

  • Online class schedules for an upcoming priority registration period are available approximately two weeks prior to the beginning of priority registration.
  • An academic advisor must approve each student’s schedule.
  • The time when a student may begin registration varies for different categories of students.
  • Students accept the responsibility for maintaining acceptable grades and for the payment of fees at the time they register.

Students who do not register before classes begin have until the last day to register, which is the 10th day of classes of a regular semester, to complete the process. During this period, a late registration fee will be assessed. No student will be permitted to register for classes after the last day to register without a serious and compelling reason approved by the dean of the student’s school or college. In no case may a student register after the last regular class day in any semester.

You can add courses online through your myOleMiss account until the course registration period ends, as noted in the academic calendar. After the fifth day of classes in the fall or spring semester, you’ll need to submit an add slip to the College or School offering the course and request permission via your go.olemiss.edu email account. Be sure to review any specific information or instructions provided on each College or School's form. For questions about adding a course, please contact the Dean's office of the College or School offering the course.

College of Liberal Arts | Course Add Form | libartsadvising@olemiss.edu

School of Accountancy | Course Add Form

School of Applied Sciences | Course Add Form | SASadvising@olemiss.edu

School of Business | Course Add Form

School of Education | Course Add Form

School of Engineering | Course Add Form

School of Journalism | Course Add Form | jour-imc@olemiss.edu

School of Pharmacy | Contact Directly

Students may add courses, using the myOleMiss portal, through the fifth day in which classes meet during a regular semester.

  • After the fifth day, students must have the approval of the instructor in the course.
  • After the 10th day of classes (the last day to register), courses may be added only under extraordinary circumstances approved by the dean of the school or college in which the student is enrolled, and a small fee will be assessed per added course.
  • In no case may a student add a class after the last regular class day in any semester.

A student may drop any course, using the online system, until the course withdrawal deadline, which is the 30th day in which classes meet during a regular semester. However, after the 10th day of classes a small fee will be assessed per dropped course. No indication of enrollment in a course properly dropped will be shown on any University of Mississippi record.

A student who wishes to withdraw from the university (i.e., withdraw from all courses) during the course of a semester, intersession, or summer term can withdraw online at myOleMiss.edu or can provide written notification via fax, mail, or in person to the Office of the Registrar.

  • Appropriate university offices (Student Housing, Financial Aid, Bursar, ID Center, Library, and Academic Dean) will be notified of the withdrawal.
  • Full refunds of tuition and fees (minus a processing fee) are given for withdrawals during the first 10 days of classes of a regular semester, and no refunds are given after the 10th day of classes.
  • Students who withdraw must apply for readmission if not enrolling for the subsequent term.
